text:
Hi HubSpot Community,

Has anyone solved this/any workarounds? We want to be able to track email clicks/opens being sent outside of HubSpot. We were looking into using tracking pixels, but HubSpot encode the link. For example: <img src="https://cW-8v04.na1.HubSpotlinks.com/Cto/LY+113/cW-8v04/VW0ZmW5BRVJLW6vkQZc77nsJrW99f7mw5jNdPFW67vc7C8fYL5t2lb1" alt="" width="1" height="1" border="0" style="display:none!important;min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important">

when you create a tracking link and use it, HubSpot does something to it, gmail does something to it, they all do something to it along the way.

The tracking aspect should still work

hey <@U05A5G5QVP1> were you ever able to loop cart.line_items? We just integrated carts from our e-commerce (magento) to HubSpot, I was able to pull cart.url and cart.name, but not the line items for some reason.
I think we ended up using a custom code action to copy them to a deal property.
There were a lot of dead ends when it came to this area.
